gurmukhi: sovq pY supn cirq icqR dyKIE cwhy shj smwiD ibKY aunmnI joiq hY
transliteration: Sovat Pai Soupan Charit Chitr Daykheeao Chaahay , Sahaj Samaadhi Bikhai Ounamanee Joti Hai ?
translation: If someone desires to see the happenings of a dream in reality, it is not possible. Similarly the divine radiance of the celestial light generated due to Naam Simran cannot be described.

gurmukhi: surwpwn s√çwd mqvwrw pRiq pRsMn ijau inJr Apwr Dwr AnBY audoq hY
transliteration: Suraapaan Svaad Matavaaraa Prati Prasann Jiu , Nijhar Apaar Dhaar Anabhai Udot Hai ?
translation: As a drunkard feels satisfied and happy drinking liquor and he alone knows about it, similarly the continuous flow of the elixir of Naam generates divine awareness that is indescribable.

gurmukhi: bwlk pY nwd bwd sbd ibDwn cwhY Anhd Duin run Jun sRuiq sRoq hY
transliteration: Baalak Pai Naad Baad Sabad Bidhaan Chaahai , Anahad Dhouni Roun Jhoun Srouti Srot Hai ?
translation: Just as a child is unable to explain the notes of music in various modes, similarly a Guru-conscious person who listens to the unstruck music cannot describe its sweetness and melody.

gurmukhi: AkQ kQw ibnod soeI jwnY jw mY bIqY cMdn sugMD ijau qrovr n goq hY ]172]
transliteration: Akad Kadaa Binod Soee Jaanai Jaa Mai Beetai , Chandan Sougandh Jiu Tarovar N Got Hai ?172?
translation: The melody of unstruck music and continuous fall of elixir as a result is beyond description. One who has the process going in his mind, experiences it. Just as the trees which are fragranced by a Sandalwood are not regarded different than the Sandalwood
